title: Computer Science
description: Foundations of programming, data structures, algorithms, and systems.

data.title: Computer Science
data.description: Foundations of programming, data structures, algorithms, and systems.

title: Variables & Types
description: Names that store values; primitive types and how to pick them.

data.title: Variables & Types
data.description: Names that store values; primitive types and how to pick them.
data.subject: computer-science

content: Variables let you associate a name with a value. Most languages give you a few primitive types (numbers, strings, booleans) and composite types (arrays/lists, objects/maps).

title: Programming Basics
description: Learn the fundamentals of programming, from variables and control flow to core data structures.

data.title: Programming Basics
data.subject: computer-science
data.description: Learn the fundamentals of programming, from variables and control flow to core data structures.

content:
Welcome to **Programming Basics**! This course introduces the core ideas behind writing software. You'll start by
understanding how programming languages represent data and how to choose the right types for the job. From there, you
will practise guiding your programs with conditional logic and loops before closing with a tour of the most common data
structures used in everyday development.

By the end, you'll be able to read and write simple programs, reason about how data moves through them, and feel ready to
dive into more advanced topics.

title: Foundations of Calculus
description: Build intuition for limits, derivatives, and integrals through visual reasoning and applied practice.

data.title: Foundations of Calculus
data.subject: mathematics
data.description: Build intuition for limits, derivatives, and integrals through visual reasoning and applied practice.

content:
Calculus describes change. In **Foundations of Calculus**, you'll explore how limits help us tame functions, how
instantaneous rates of change appear through derivatives, and how integrals accumulate quantities over intervals.

Each module mixes geometric insight with problem-solving strategies so you can connect theory to applications in
science and engineering. Completing the course equips you with the mental models needed for further study in analysis,
physics, and beyond.

title: Limits & Continuity
description: Understanding the behaviour of functions as inputs approach a value.

data.title: Limits & Continuity
data.description: Understanding the behaviour of functions as inputs approach a value.
data.subject: mathematics

content:
Limits formalize the idea of getting arbitrarily close to a value. By studying limits you learn how functions behave near
points where they might otherwise be undefined and lay the groundwork for derivatives and integrals.
